project_overview.name: Hydrogen Credit Trading Platform
project_overview.theme: Green Hydrogen Fuel & Blue Carbon Ecosystem
project_overview.description: A blockchain-based platform where producers, buyers, and verifiers can trade and validate hydrogen credits in a transparent, tamper-proof manner.

roles.producer: Can generate (mint) new hydrogen credits, transfer them, or use them. Producers can also act as buyers when needed.
roles.buyer: Can purchase hydrogen credits from producers or other buyers. Buyers can also transfer credits to others.
roles.verifier: A trusted authority that verifies the authenticity of hydrogen credit batches before they can be traded.

authentication.note: No private keys are stored in the backend. Signing of transactions always happens locally in the user's wallet.

auth.signup: POST /auth/signup/ - Register a new user with wallet address and role.
auth.login: POST /auth/login/ - Authenticate user by wallet address and return token.

credits.mint: POST /api/mint/ - Producers mint new credits (requires verifier approval).
credits.batch_verification: POST /api/batch/ - Verifier validates a batch of credits.

dashboard.view: GET /api/dashboard/ - Fetch user-specific information like balance, transfers, and history.

ai_chatbot.purpose: Acts as a knowledge assistant for the hackathon project.
capabilities: Answer user queries about platform workflow, endpoints, and roles.
Provide guidance on how to mint, transfer, or use credits (conceptual explanation).
Retrieve and explain data from the dashboard or API endpoints.
Explain project theme and hackathon-specific context.
limitations: Does not access or require private keys.
Does not replace Metamask or wallet signing process.
Only works with knowledge base and public API responses.
sample_prompts: How does verification of batches work?
What can buyers and producers both do?
Show me my credit balance from the dashboard API.
